DataElement.preferredName: Thymus Disease Assessment Fat Measurement Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value representing the fat content of the thymus gland at disease assessment using a grading classification based on CT characteristics of the thymus in adults as described by Simanovsky N, et al. (2012)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Thymus Gland Disease Assessment Timepoint Fat Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bi-lobed organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is located in the upper anterior portion of the chest, behind the sternum. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and fewer epithelial cells. Connective tissue septa separate the lobes into lobules. The lobules contain an outer portion (cortical zone) which is rich in lymphocytes and an inner portion (medullary zone) which is rich in epithelial cells. It is an organ essential for the development of the immune system. Its function is the maturation of the progenitor lymphoid cells to thymocytes and subsequently to mature T-cells. It reaches its greatest weight at puberty and subsequently begins to involute._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The determination of the amount of fat present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bi-lobed organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is located in the upper anterior portion of the chest, behind the sternum. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and fewer epithelial cells. Connective tissue septa separate the lobes into lobules. The lobules contain an outer portion (cortical zone) which is rich in lymphocytes and an inner portion (medullary zone) which is rich in epithelial cells. It is an organ essential for the development of the immune system. Its function is the maturation of the progenitor lymphoid cells to thymocytes and subsequently to mature T-cells. It reaches its greatest weight at puberty and subsequently begins to involute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Thymus composition is up to 25% solid tissue
